p.span: This setup if for IT companies reselling software licenses, and consulting services. The typical sale is a 1 year Oracle Database license that is purchased to Oracle, and resold to client at a margin, with extra services to setup the database.

template.p: Licenses are managed as tasks in the project management app, with custom properties; license key, number of users, software version, ... these properties depend on the type of software sold (i.e. Odoo is sold based on the number of users periodically, but Oracle requires a lot of information: number of CPUs, number of developer seats, size of DB, etc)
Open the Sales App and create a subscriptionâ€‹ to any customer with the product "Oracle Database", for 5 users for one year. Once you confirm this order, two documents will be created:

ul.li: A purchase order to Oracle; to buy the license for this client
A task to manage the license, in stage "New Requests"

template.p: From the subscription, using the top buttons, jump to the purchase order to buy these licenses to Oracle. You can send by email your request for quotation, then confirm the order. At that point, Oracle will send you the license number.
Go back to the sale order, then jump to the task. On the task, set the different informations based on what oracle sends you:

ul.li: Deadline: corresponding to the license key expiration date

template.p: In the chatter, leverage the email template to send those information to your customer by hitting the Send message button, opening the full composer and then selecting the Send licenses template from the three dots menu of the composer bottom bar. The sent email appears in the chatter!

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

div.p: You can customize the email template with additional details and instructions, even including additional documents such as license setup procedure.

template.p: From the Licenses App, specially tailored for the Software reseller industry, you an have an overview of all your software licenses. Click on one specific license to track license keys belonging to each customer.

ul.li: Record all information related to the license (version, type of license, ...). These information are different from one license type to another (Oracle vs Odoo)
You can communicate with customers on the chatter, to keep an history of the discussions or leverage the email template as mentioned previously.
Licenses to rework: licenses for which you have to some work periodically

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-success pb-0 pt-3

div.p: A studio scheduled action automatically turns the license state to Changes Requested when the license key expires within 15 days.

template.p: To renew a license, you should just renew the subscription from the sale order; the task remains the same.

Usually, you sell the software licenses with additional services. To test this flow from the Sales App, as you create a quotation, use the quotation template
"Odoo Standard Implementation" . That will add the services billed on timesheets (default setup: sell days, but timesheets per hour).

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

div.p: From the Product Sales tab, you can also add development serves in one click as Optional Products.

template.p: As you confirm the order, it will:

li.font: Create a purchase order for the Odoo license to Odoo S.A.

ul.li: Create a task to track the license
Create 200 hours to plan, in the planning

template.p: As you confirm the order, the license line is blue as you can already invoice it. The consulting services are black as there is nothing to invoice; you'll be able to invoice at the end of the month, based on the time spent on the project.

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

div.p: On this order, the way to manage licenses is similar to the above section. So, we'll mostly focus on the delivery of the extra services.

template.p: From the Planning App, click New:

ul.li: Select the services to plan "Business Need Analysis" and "Odoo Configuration" (training will be planned later on, on phase 2)
Assign these services to the right person and make this fit in their shifts.

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-success pb-0 pt-3

div.p: Alternativelly you can leverage the roles assigned to your employees and leverage the "Auto Plan" capability beside the Publish button. This creates and assign all shifts automatically.

template.p: Don't forget to hit the Publish button from your planning to let your employees know what their coming weeks look like.

From the Timesheet App, or on one task, consultants and developers can timesheet their spent time on the different phases of the project: Business Need Analysis, Odoo Configuration, or Training & Support. This will be reflected as "Delivered Quantity" on the sale order lines.
At the end of the month, salespeople go to the menu "Orders to Invoice" in Sales App. From there they can select an order (or select all), and invoice what has been delivered on the order.
